lines.value: analisis numeris nyaeta pangajaran algoritma keur pasualan pasualanmatematika kontinyu keur ngabedakeun jeung matematika diskrit
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of the earliest mathematical writings is the babylonian tablet ybc 7289 which gives a sexagesimal numerical approximation of modern numerical analysis does not seek exact answers because exact answers are impossible to obtain in practice
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: instead much of numerical analysis is concerned with obtaining approximate solutions while maintaining reasonable bounds on errors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: numerical analysis naturally finds applications in all fields of engineering and the physical sciences but in the 21st century the life sciences and even the arts have adopted elements of scientific computations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ordinary differential equations appear in the movement of heavenly bodies planets stars and galaxies optimization occurs in portfolio management numerical linear algebra is essential to quantitative psychology stochastic differential equations and markov chains are essential in simulating living cells for medicine and biology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before the advent of modern computers numerical methods often depended on hand interpolation in large printed tables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nowadays after mid 20th century these tables have fallen into disuse because computers can calculate the required functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the interpolation algorithms nevertheless may be used as part of the software for solving differential equations and the like
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we will now outline several important themes of numerical analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the overall goal is the design and analysis of techniques to give approximate solutions to hard problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to fix ideas the reader might consider the following problems and methods
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the field of numerical analysis predates the invention of modern computers by many centuries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: linear interpolation was already in use more than 2000 years ago
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many great mathematicians of the past were preoccupied by numerical analysis as is obvious from the names of important algorithms like newton's method lagrange interpolation polynomial gaussian elimination or euler's method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to facilitate computations by hand large books were produced with formulas and tables of data such as interpolation points and function coefficients
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: using these tables often calculated out to 16 decimal places or more for some functions one could look up values to plug into the formulas given and achieve very good numerical estimates of some functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the canonical work in the field is the nist publication edited by abramowitz and stegun a 1000-plus page book of a very large number of commonly used formulas and functions and their values at many points
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the function values are no longer very useful when a computer is available but the large listing of formulas can still be very handy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mechanical calculator was also developed as a tool for hand computation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these calculators evolved into electronic computers in the 1940s and it was then found that these computers were also useful for administrative purposes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: but the invention of the computer also influenced the field of numerical analysis since now longer and more complicated calculations could be done
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the algorithm might return any number in that range with an error less than 0.2
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note that f(1.1 = 10 and f(1.001 = 1000 a change in x of less than 0.1 turns into a change in f(x of nearly 1000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: evaluating f(x near x = 1 is an ill conditioned problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: well posed problem by contrast the function is continuous and so evaluating it is well posed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: direct methods compute the solution to a problem in a finite number of steps
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these methods would give the precise answer if they were performed in infinite precision arithmetic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples include gaussian elimination the qr factorization method for solving systemsof linear equations and the simplex method of linear programming
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in practice finite precision is used and the result is an approximation of the true solution assuming stability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in contrast to direct methods iterative methods are not expected to terminate in a number of steps
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: starting from an initial guess iterative methods form successive approximations that converge to the exact solution only in the limit
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a convergence criterion is specified in order to decide when a sufficiently accurate solution has hopefully been found
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even in infinite precision arithmetic these methods would not reach the solution in finitely many steps in general
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples include newton's method the bisection method and jacobi iteration
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in computational matrix algebra iterative methods are generally needed for large problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: iterative methods are more common than direct methods in numerical analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some methods are direct in principle but are usually used as though they were not e.g gmres and the conjugate gradient method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for these methods the number of steps needed to obtain the exact solution is so large that an approximation is accepted in the same manner as for an iterative method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore continuous problems must sometimes be replaced by a discrete problem whose solution is known to approximate that of the continuous problem this process is called discretization
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the solution of a differential equation is a function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this function must be represented by a finite amount of data for instance by its value at a finite number of points at its domain even though this domain is a continuum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the study of errors forms an important part of numerical analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are several ways in which error can be introduced in the solution of the problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: round off errors arise because it is impossible to represent all real numbers exactly on a finite state machine which is what all practical digital computers are
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on a pocket calculator if one enters 0.0000000000001 or the maximum number of zeros possible then a + and then 100000000000000 again the maximum number of zeros possible one will obtain the number 100000000000000 again and not 100000000000000.0000000000001
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the calculator's answer is incorrect because of roundoff in the calculation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: truncation errors are committed when an iterative method is terminated and the approximate solution differs from the exact solution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: similarly discretization induces a discretization error because the solution of the discrete problem does not coincide with the solution of the continuous problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance in the iteration in the sidebar to compute the solution of after 10 or so iterations we conclude that the root is roughly 1.99 for example
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we therefore have a truncation error of 0.01
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once an error is generated it will generally propagate through the calculation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance we have already noted that the operation + on a calculator or a computer is inexact
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it follows that a calculation of the type a+b+c+d+e is even more inexact
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this leads to the notion of numerical stability an algorithm is numerically stable if an error once it is generated does not grow too much during the calculation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is only possible if the problem is well conditioned meaning that the solution changes by only a small amount if the problem data are changed by a small amount
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indeed if a problem is ill conditioned then any error in the data will grow a lot
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however an algorithm that solves a well conditioned problem may or may not be numerically stable
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an art of numerical analysis is to find a stable algorithm for solving a well posed mathematical problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance computing the square root of 2 which is roughly 1.41421 is a well posed problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many algorithms solve this problem by starting with an initial approximation x 1 to for instance x 1 =1.4 and then computing improved guesses x 2 , x 3 , etc one such method is the famous babylonian method which is given by x k+1 = x k 2 + 1/x k
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another iteration which we will call method x is given by x k + 1 = x k 2 −2 2 + x k
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we have calculated a few iterations of each scheme in table form below with initial guesses x 1 = 1.4 and x 1 = 1.42
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: observe that the babylonian method converges fast regardless of the initial guess whereas method x converges extremely slowly with initial guess 1.4 and diverges for initial guess 1.42
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hence the babylonian method is said to be numerically stable while method x is said to be numerically unstable
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the field of numerical analysis is divided in different disciplines according to the problem that is to be solved
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of the simplest problems is the evaluation of a function at a given point
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most straightforward approach of just plugging in the number in the formula is sometimes not very efficient
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for polynomials a better approach is using the horner scheme since it reduces the necessary number of multiplications and additions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: generally it is important to estimate and control round off errors arising from the use of floating point arithmetic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: interpolation solves the following problem given the value of some unknown function at a number of points what value does that function have at some other point between the given points
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a very simple method is to use linear interpolation which assumes that the unknown function is linear between every pair of successive points
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can be generalized to polynomial interpolation which is sometimes more accurate but suffers from runge's phenomenon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other interpolation methods use localized functions like splines or wavelets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: extrapolation is very similar to interpolation except that now we want to find the value of the unknown function at a point which is outside the given points
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: regression is also similar but it takes into account that the data is imprecise
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: given some points and a measurement of the value of some function at these points with an error we want to determine the unknown function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the least squares method is one popular way to achieve this
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another fundamental problem is computing the solution of some given equation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two cases are commonly distinguished depending on whether the equation is linear or not
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance the equation is not
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: much effort has been put in the development of methods for solving systems of linear equations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: standard direct methods i.e methods that use some matrix decomposition are gaussian elimination lu decomposition cholesky decomposition for symmetric or hermitian and positive definite matrix and qr decomposition for non square matrices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: iterative methods such as the jacobi method gauss seidel method successive over relaxation and conjugate gradient method are usually preferred for large systems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: root finding algorithms are used to solve nonlinear equations they are so named since a root of a function is an argument for which the function yields zero
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the function is differentiable and the derivative is known then newton's method is a popular choice
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: linearization is another technique for solving nonlinear equations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several important problems can be phrased in terms of eigenvalue decompositions or singular value decompositions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance the spectral image compression algorithm is based on the singular value decomposition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the corresponding tool in statistics is called principal component analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one application is to automatically find the 100 top subjects of discussion on the web and to then classify each web page according to which subject it belongs to
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: optimization problems ask for the point at which a given function is maximized or minimized
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often the point also has to satisfy some constraints
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the field of optimization is further split in several subfields depending on the form of the objective function and the constraint
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance linear programming deals with the case that both the objective function and the constraints are linear
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a famous method in linear programming is the simplex method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the method of lagrange multipliers can be used to reduce optimization problems with constraints to unconstrained optimization problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: numerical integration in some instances also known as numerical quadrature asks for the value of a definite integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: popular methods use one of the newton cotes formulas like the midpoint rule or simpson's rule or gaussian quadrature
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these methods rely on a divide and conquer strategy whereby an integral on a relatively large set is broken down into integrals on smaller sets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in higher dimensions where these methods become prohibitively expensive in terms of computational effort one may use monte carlo or quasi monte carlo methods see monte carlo integration or in modestly large dimensions the method of sparse grids
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: :main articles numerical ordinary differential equations numerical partial differential equations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: numerical analysis is also concerned with computing in an approximate way the solution of differential equations both ordinary differential equations and partial differential equations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: partial differential equations are solved by first discretizing the equation bringing it into a finite dimensional subspace
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can be done by a finite element method a finite difference method or particularly in engineering a finite volume method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the theoretical justification of these methods often involves theorems from functional analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this reduces the problem to the solution of an algebraic equation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the late twentieth century most algorithms are implemented and run on a computer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the netlib repository contains various collections of software routines for numerical problems mostly in fortran and c commercial products implementing many different numerical algorithms include the imsl and nag libraries a free alternative is the gnu scientific library
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: matlab is a popular commercial programming language for numerical scientific calculations but there are commercial alternatives such as s plus and idl or semi free alternative scilab as well as free and open source alternatives such as freemat gnu octave similar to matlab it++ a c++ library r similar to s plus and certain variants of python
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: performance varies widely while vector and matrix operations are usually fast scalar loops vary in speed by more than an order of magnitude
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many computer algebra systems such as mathematica or maple free software systems include sage maxima axiom and yacas can also be used for numerical computations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however their strength typically lies in symbolic computations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also any spreadsheet software can be used to solve simple problems relating to numerical analysis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the four main types of tea are distinguished by their processing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: camellia sinensis is an evergreen shrub whose leaves if not quickly dried after picking soon begin to wilt and oxidize
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this process resembles the malting of barley in that starch is converted into sugars the leaves turn progressively darker as chlorophyll breaks down and tannins are released
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next step in processing is to stop the oxidation process at a predetermined stage by removing the water from the leaves via heating
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the term fermentation was used probably by wine fanciers to describe this process and has stuck even though no true fermentation happens i.e the process is not driven by microbes and produces no ethanol
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: without careful moisture and temperature control fungi will grow on tea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the fungi will cause fermentation which will contaminate the tea with toxic and carcinogenic substances
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fact when real fermentation happens the tea must be discarded
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tea is traditionally classified into five main groups based on the degree or period of fermentation oxidation the leaves have undergone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are several tea preparations available which do not fit into the usual nomenclature
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: almost all teas in tea bags and most other teas are blends
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though recently with improvements in the dry freeze technique and the improved infusion method tea powder and condensed tea essence that only needs hot or cold water to make a cup of tea are sold
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: blending may occur at the level of tea planting area e.g assam or teas from many areas may be blended
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the aim of blending is a stable taste over different years and a better price
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more expensive more tasty tea may cover the inferior taste of cheaper tea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are various teas which have additives and or different processing than pure varieties
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tea is able to easily receive any aroma which may cause problems in processing transportation or storage of tea but can be also advantageously used to prepare scented teas

lines.value: those that use cha or chai derivatives include albanian arabic bulgarian,bangla croatian czech greek hindi japanese 茶 ちゃ cha korean nepali chia persian portuguese romanian russian yan chai serbian slovak slovene caj swahili tagalog thai tibetan turkish malayalam ukrainian and vietnamese che or tra

lines.value: it is tempting to correlate these names with the route that was used to deliver tea to these cultures but this correspondence does not follow

lines.value: for example most british trade went through canton which uses cha

lines.value: in ireland or at least in dublin the term cha is sometimes used for tea with tay as a common pronunciation throughout the land and char was a common slang term for tea throughout british empire and commonwealth military forces in the 19th and 20th centuries crossing over into civilian usage

lines.value: in north america the word chai is used to refer almost exclusively to the indian chai or masala chai beverage

lines.value: perhaps the only place in which a word unrelated to tea is used to describe the beverage is south america particularly andean countries because a similar stimulant beverage hierba mate was consumed there long before tea arrived

lines.value: in various places of south america any tea is referred to as mate

lines.value: this section describes the most widespread method of making tea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: completely different methods are used in north africa tibet and perhaps in other places the best way to prepare tea is usually thought to be with loose tea placed either directly in a teapot or contained in a tea infuser rather than a teabag

lines.value: however perfectly acceptable tea can be made with teabags
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some circumvent the teapot stage altogether and brew the tea directly in a cup or mug

lines.value: historically in china tea is divided into first second third and fourth and fifth infusions

lines.value: the first infusion of tea made is immediately poured out to wash the tea and then the second and further infusions are then had

lines.value: the third through fifth are nearly always considered the best infusions of tea although different teas open up differently and may require more infusions of boiling water to bring them to life

lines.value: <!the corpus luteum is the solid body formed in the ovaries after the egg has been released from the fallopian tube which continues to grow and divide for a while
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after ovulation the residual follicle transforms into the corpus luteum under the support of the pituitary hormones
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this corpus luteum will produce progesterone in addition to estrogens for approximately the next 2 weeks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: progesterone plays a vital role in converting the proliferative endometrium into a secretory lining receptive for implantation and supportive of the early pregnancy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it raises the body temperature by half to one degree fahrenheit one-quarter to one half degree celsius thus women who record their temperature on a daily basis will notice that they have entered the luteal phase
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if fertilisation of an egg has occurred it will travel as an early embryo through the tube to the uterine cavity and implant itself 6 to 12 days after ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shortly after implantation the growing embryo will signal its existence to the maternal system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one very early signal consists of human chorionic gonadotropin hcg a hormone that pregnancy tests can measure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this signal has an important role in maintaining the corpus luteum and enabling it to continue to produce progesterone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the absence of a pregnancy and without hcg the corpus luteum demises and inhibin and progesterone levels fall
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this will set the stage for the next cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: progesterone withdrawal leads to menstrual shedding progesterone withdrawal bleeding and falling inhibin levels allow fsh levels to rise to raise a new crop of follicles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in many women various unpleasant symptoms caused by the involved hormones and by cramping of the uterus can precede or accompany menstruation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more severe symptoms may include significant menstrual pain dysmenorrhea abdominal pain migraine headaches depression and irritability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some women encounter premenstrual stress syndrome pms or premenstrual syndrome a cyclic clinical entity
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other women are said to suffer from what some doctors call post menstrual syndrome where similar symptoms manifest themseleves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is rare and is usually not as severe or as long as pre menstrual syndrome
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: breast discomfort caused by premenstrual water retention is very common
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the list of symptoms experienced varies from person to person
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore within an individual the severity of the symptoms may vary from cycle to cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pharmaceutical and herbal companies provide products designed to lessen or relieve some or all of these symptoms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the length of the follicular phase &mdash and consequently the length of the menstrual cycle &mdash may vary widely
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the luteal phase however almost always takes the same number of days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some women have a luteal phase of 10 days others of 16 days the average is 14 days but for each individual woman this length will remain constant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sperm survive inside a woman for 3 days on average with survival time up to five days considered normal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a pregnancy resulting from sperm life of eight days has been documented
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most fertile period the time with the highest likelihood of sexual intercourse leading to pregnancy covers the time from some 5 days before ovulation until 1-2 days after ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in an average 28 day cycle with a 14-day luteal phase this corresponds to the second and the beginning of the third week of the cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fertility awareness methods of birth control attempt to determine the precise time of ovulation in order to find the relatively fertile and the relatively infertile days in the cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: people who have heard about the menstrual cycle and ovulation may commonly and mistakenly assume for contraceptive purposes that menstrual cycles always take a regular 28 days and that ovulation always occurs 14 days after beginning of the menses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this assumption may lead to unintended pregnancies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note too that not every bleeding event counts as a menstruation and this can mislead people in their calculation of the fertile window
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if a woman wants to conceive the most fertile time occurs between 19 and 10 days prior to the expected menses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many women use ovulation detection kits that detect the presence of the lh surge in the urine to indicate the most fertile time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other ovulation detection systems rely on observation of one or more of the three primary fertility signs basal body temperature cervical fluid and cervical position
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: among women living closely together the onsets of menstruation may tend to synchronise somewhat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: researchers first described this phenomenon in 1971 and explained it by the action of pheromones in 1998 stern and mcclintock 1998
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however subsequent research has called this conclusion into question
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: extreme intricacies regulate the menstrual cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for many years researchers have argued over which regulatory system has ultimate control the hypothalamus the pituitary or the ovary with its growing follicle but all three systems have to interact
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in any scenario the growing follicle has a critical role it matures the lining provides the appropriate feedback to the hypothalamus and pituitary and modifies the mucus changes at the cervix
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two sex hormones play a role in the control of the menstrual cycle estradiol and progesterone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while estrogen peaks twice during follicular growth and during the luteal phase progesterone remains virtually absent prior to ovulation but becomes critical in the luteal phase and during pregnancy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many tests for ovulation check for the presence of progesterone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these sex hormones come under the influence of the pituitary gland and both fsh and lh play necessary roles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fsh stimulates immature follicles in the ovaries to grow
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lh triggers ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the gonadotropin releasing hormone of the hypothalamus controls the pituitary yet both the pituitary and the hypothalamus receive feedback from the follicle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after ovulation the corpus luteum &mdash which develops from the burst follicle and remains in the ovary &mdash secretes both estradiol and progesterone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only if pregnancy occurs do hormones appear in order to suspend the menstrual cycle while production of estradiol and progesterone continues
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: abnormal hormonal regulation leads to disturbance in the menstrual cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some women with neurological conditions experience increased activity of their conditions at about the same time every month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 80 percent of women with epilepsy have more seizures than usual in the phase of their cycle when progresterone declines and estrogen increases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mice have been used as an experimental system to investigate possible mechanisms by which levels of sex steroid hormones might regulate nervous system function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the part of the mouse estrous cycle when progesterone is highest the level of nerve cell gaba receptor subtype delta was high
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since these gaba receptors are inhibitory nerve cells with more delta receptors are less likely to fire than cells with lower numbers of delta receptors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the part of the mouse estrous cycle when estrogen levels are higher than progesterone levels the number of delta receptors decrease increasing nerve cell activity in turn increasing anxiety and seizure susceptibility
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: maguire et al 2005
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unlike almost all other species the external physical changes of a human female near ovulation are very subtle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a woman may sense her own ovulation while it may remain indiscernible to others this is considered to have sociobiological significance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in contrast other species often signal receptivity through heat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the great apes are the only other mammals to have hidden ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: evidence suggests that eggs are formed from germ cells early in fetal life
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the number is reduced to an estimated 400000 to 450000 immature eggs residing in each ovary at puberty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the menstrual cycle as a biologic event allows for ovulation of one egg typically each month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus over her lifetime a woman will ovulate approximately 400 to 450 times
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all the other eggs dissolve by a process called atresia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as a woman's total egg supply is formed in fetal life to be ovulated decades later it has been suggested that this long lifetime may make the chromatin of eggs more vulnerable to division problems breakage and mutation than the chromatin of sperm which are produced continuously during a man's reproductive life
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this possibility is supported by the observation that fetuses and infants of older mothers have higher rates of chromosome abnormalities than those of older fathers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: not all menstruations result from an ovulatory menstrual cycle anovulatory cycle literally an- absence of ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in some women follicular development may start but not complete nevertheless estrogens will form and will stimulate the uterine lining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sooner or later the uterus will shed this lining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as no ovulation and no progesterone involvement occurs doctors call this type of bleeding an estrogen breakthrough bleeding and cannot always predict its duration or frequency
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: anovulatory bleeding commonly occurs prior to menopause premenopause or in women with polycystic ovary syndrome
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: infrequent or irregular ovulation is called oligoovulation.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the normal menstrual cycle occurs every 28 days ± 7 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the medical term for cycles with intervals of 21 days or fewer is polymenorrhea and on the other hand the term for cycles with intervals exceeding 35 days is oligomenorrhea or amenorrhea if intervals exceed 180 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the normal menstrual flow amounts to 50 ml ± 30 ml
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it follows a crescendo decrescendo pattern that is it starts at a moderate level increases somewhat and then slowly tapers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sudden heavy flows or amounts in excess of 80 ml hypermenorrhea or menorrhagia may stem from hormonal disturbance uterine abnormalities including uterine leiomyoma or cancer and other causes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: doctors call the opposite phenomenon of bleeding very little hypomenorrhea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the typical woman bleeds is on her period for three to seven days out of each month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: prolonged bleeding metrorrhagia also meno metrorrhagia no longer shows a clear interval pattern
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dysfunctional uterine bleeding refers to hormonally caused bleeding abnormalities typically anovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all these bleeding abnormalities need medical attention they may indicate hormone imbalances uterine fibroids or other problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as pregnant patients may bleed a pregnancy test forms part of the evaluation of abnormal bleeding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: estrogens and progesterone like hormones make up the main active ingredients of birth control pills
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: typically they tend to mimic a menstrual cycle in appearance but to suppress the critical event of the ovulatory cycle namely ovulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: normally a woman takes hormone pills for 21 days followed by 7 days of non functional placebo sugar pills or no pills at all then the cycle starts again
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the 7 placebo days a withdrawal bleeding occurs this differs from ordinary menstruation and skipping the placebos and continuing with the next batch of hormone pills may suppress it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two main versions of the pill exist monophasic and triphasic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with triphasic pills skipping of the placebos and continuing with the next month's dose can make a woman more likely to experience spotting or breakthrough bleeding in 2003 the united states food and drug administration fda approved low dose monophasic birth control pills which induce withdrawal bleedings only every 3 months
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the terms menstruation and menses come from the latin mensis month which in turn relates to the greek mene moon and to the roots of the english words month and moon &mdash reflecting the fact that the moon also takes close to 28 days to revolve around the earth actually 27.32 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the synodical lunar month the period between two new moons or full moons is 29.53 days long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many women when not being exposed to artificial nighttime lighting find that their menstrual cycles occur in rhythm with the lunar cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while some women allow their menses to flow freely or learn to recognise when their menses will flow most women prefer to use some artificial means to absorb or catch their menses to prevent soiling their clothes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are a number of different methods used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: much debate centers around which menstrual products to use
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the main debate can be summarized as one between the convenience availability and general knowledge of disposables versus the environmental monetary and potential health benefits of reuseables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a secondary aspect of this is commercial responsibility
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: disposable menstrual products compose a large and powerful industry in the west with a near monopoly on advertising supermarket shelves and menstrual education
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this leads many people to believe that these corporate products are their only options
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many people object to the negative portrayal of menstruation in advertising menstruation is portrayed as shameful unnatural smelly and hindering
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in contrast the reuseable menstrual products industry is composed mostly of small independent and woman owned woman positive businesses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: finally some believe that the disposable menstrual products industry is imperialist forcing or coercing women of other cultures to leave their reuseable inexpensive or free menstrual products to become consumers of disposables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a summary of the main issues of debate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mystics have sometimes elaborated equivalencies analogising the waxing and waning of the moon with influences on human menstruation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this spiritual moon goddess or astrological context some women call menstruation their moontime

lines.value: some ancient views also regarded menstruation as a cleansing of the body compare bloodletting as a major medical treatment of pre modern times

lines.value: many religions have menstruation related rituals

lines.value: some christian denominations including some but by no means all authorities of the orthodox church advise women not to receive communion during their menstrual period

lines.value: other denominations follow the rules laid out in the holiness code section of leviticus somewhat similar to the jewish ritual of niddah

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during menstrual cycle women are not allowed to perform prayers and fasting

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while orthodox jews follow this exclusion many jews in other branches of the religion do not

lines.value: during the menses hindu woman avoid routine work to maintain religious privacy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they do not go into the kitchen or pooja room
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they do not touch any member of the family and dont exchange clothes with them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they use mats and wollen as bed for sleeping
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the privacy is maintained for three days with the starting day counted as one day
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on fourth day morning she takes bath and ends the ritual
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on the fifth day she takes an oil bath and is back to the regular routine

lines.value: the practice is used in various forms by all hindus but strictly followed by brahmins

lines.value: a regular menstrual cycle as described here only occurs in the great apes

lines.value: there have been very rare examples where the spots of a normal black leopard have coalesced to give a jet black leopard with no visible markings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pseudo melanism abundism occurs in leopards
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the spots are more densely packed than normal and merge to largely obscure the background colour
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they may form swirls and in some places solid black areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unlike a true black leopard the tawny background colour is visible in places
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one pseudo melanistic leopard had a tawny orange coat with coalescing rosettes and spots but white belly with normal black spots like a black and tan dog
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in harmsworth natural history 1910 r lydekker described pseudo melanistic leopard there is however a peculiar dark phase in south africa a specimen of which was obtained in 1885 in hilly land covered with scrub jungle near grahamstown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ground colour of this animal was a rich tawny with an orange tinge but the spots instead of being of the usual rosette like form were nearly all small and solid like those on the head of an ordinary leopard while from the top of the head to near the root of the tail the spots became almost confluent producing the appearance of a broad streak of black running down the back
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a second skin had the black area embracing nearly the whole of the back and flanks without showing any trace of the spots while in those portions of the skin where the latter remained they were of the same form as in the first specimen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two other specimens are known the whole four having been obtained from the albany district
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these dark coloured south african leopards differ from the black leopards of the northern and eastern parts of africa and asia in that while in the latter the rosette like spots are always retained and clearly visible in the former the rosettes are lost as indeed is to a considerable extent often the case in ordinary african leopards and all trace of spots disappears from the blacker portions of the skin another pseudo melanistic leopard skin was described in 1915 by holdridge ozro collins who had purchased it in 1912
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it had been killed in malabar india that same year

lines.value: the wide black portion which glistens like the sheen of silk velvet extends from the top of the head to the extremity of the tail entirely free from any white or tawny hairs in the tiger the stripes are black of a uniform character upon a tawny background and they run in parallel lines from the centre of the back to the belly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this skin the stripes are almost golden yellow without the uniformity and parallelism of the tiger characteristics and they extend along the sides in labyrinthine graceful curls and circles several inches below the wide shimmering black continuous course of the back
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: between 1885 and 1934 six pseudo melanistic leopards were recorded in the albany and grahamstown districts of south africa

lines.value: <!most bacteria are relatively small and possess distinctive cell and colony morphologies shapes as described below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most important bacterial structural characteristic is the cell wall
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria can be divided into two groups gram positive and gram negative based on differences in cell wall structure as revealed by gram staining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: gram positive bacteria possess a cell wall containing a thick peptidoglycan called murein in older sources layer and teichoic acids while gram negative bacteria have an outer lipopolysaccharide containing membrane and a thin peptidoglycan layer located in the periplasm the region between the outer and cytoplasmic membranes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many bacteria contain other extracellular structures such as flagella and fimbriae which are used for motility movement attachment and conjugation respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacteria also contain capsules or slime layers that also facilitate bacterial attachment to surfaces and biofilm formation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria contain relatively few intracellular structures compared to eukaryotes but do contain a tightly supercoiled chromosome ribosomes and several other species specific structures such as intracellular membranes nutrient storage structures gas vesicles and magnetosomes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacteria are capable of forming endospores which allows them to survive extreme environmental and chemical stresses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this property is restricted to specific gram positive organisms such as bacillus and clostridium
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: main article metabolisme microbial in contrast to higher organisms bacteria exhibit an extremely wide variety of metabolic types
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fact it is widely accepted that eukaryotic metabolism is largely a derivative of bacterial metabolism with mitochondria having descended from a lineage within the a-proteobacteria and chloroplasts from the cyanobacteria by ancient endosymbiotic events
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacterial metabolism can be divided broadly on the basis of the kind of energy used for growth electron donors and electron acceptors and by the source of carbon used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most bacteria are heterotrophic using organic carbon compounds as both carbon and energy sources
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in aerobic organisms oxygen is used as the terminal electron acceptor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in anaerobic organisms other inorganic compounds such as nitrate sulfate or carbon dioxide as terminal electron acceptors leading to the environmentally important processes of denitrification sulfate reduction and acetogenesis respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: non respiratory anaerobes use fermentation to generate energy and reducing power secreting metabolic by products such as ethanol in brewing as waste
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: facultative anaerobes can switch between fermentation and different terminal electron acceptors depending on the environmental conditions in which they find themselves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as an alternative to heterotrophy many bacteria are autotrophic fixing carbon dioxide into cell mass
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: energy metabolism of bacteria is either based on phototrophy or chemotrophy i e the use of either light or exergonic chemical reactions for fueling life processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lithotrophic bacteria use inorganic electron donors for respiration chemolthotrophs or biosynthesis and carbon dioxide fixation photolithotrophs opposed by organotrophs which need organic compounds as electron donors for biosynthetic reactions and mostly as well as carbon sources
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: common inorganic electron donors are hydrogen ammonia leading to nitrification iron and several reduced sulfur compounds
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in both aerobic phototrophy and chemolithotrophy oxygen is used as a terminal electron acceptor while under anaerobic conditions inorganic compounds see above are used instead
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most photolithotrophic and chemolithotrophic organisms are autotrophic meaning that they obtain cellular carbon by fixation of carbon dioxide whereas photoorganotrophic and chemoorganotrophic organisms are heterotrophic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition to carbon some organisms also fix nitrogen gas nitrogen fixation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this environmentally important trait can be found in bacteria of nearly all the metabolic types listed above but is not universal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the distribution of metabolic traits within a group of organisms has traditionally been used to define their taxonomy although these traits often do not correspond with genetic techniques see groups and identification below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sakabeh bakteri baranahan ku cara reproduksi aseksual binary fission nu hasilna mangrupa pembagian sel
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two identical clone daughter cells are produced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacteria while still reproducing asexually form more complex reproductive structures that facilitate the dispersal of the newly formed daughter cells
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples include fruiting body formation by myxococcus and arial hyphae formation by streptomyces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the laboratory bacteria are usually grown using two methods solid and liquid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: solid growth media such as agar plates are used to isolate pure cultures of a bacterial strain
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when quantitation of growth or large volumes of cells are required liquid growth media are generally used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: growth in liquid media with stirring most often occurs as an even cell suspension making the cultures easier to divide and transfer compared to solid media although the isolation of individual cells from liquid media is extremely difficult
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in both liquid and solid media there exist a finite amount of nutrients which allows for the study of the bacterial cell cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these limitations can be avoided by the use of a chemostat which maintains a bacterial culture under steady state conditions by the continuous addition of nutrients and the removal of waste products and cells
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: large chemostats are often used for industrial scale microbial processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most techniques commonly used to grow bacteria are designed to optimise the amount of cells produced the amount of time needed to produce them and the cost to produce them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in a bacterium's natural environment nutrients are limited meaning that bacteria cannot continue to reproduce indefinitely
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this constant limitation of nutrients has led the evolution of many different growth strategies in different types of organisms see r/k selection theory
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some possess the ability to grow extremely rapidly when nutrients become available such as the formation of algal and cyanobacterial blooms that often occur in lakes during the summer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other organisms have devised more specialized strategies to make them more successful in a harsh environment such as the production of antibiotics by streptomyces often at the expense of a slower growth rate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in a natural environment many organisms live in communities e.g biofilms which may allow for increased supply of nutrients and protection of environmental stresses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often these relationships are essential for growth of a particular organism or group of organisms syntrophy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these evolutionary tactics to overcome nutrient limitation must be accounted for in an industrial laboratory bacterial growth experiment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance bacteria that tend to agglutinate may need more vigorous stirring to break apart any large bacterial masses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the main growth attribute that must be understood for controlled growth is that bacteria have defined growth phases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a controlled bacterial growth will follow three distinct phases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nearly all cultures start from taking a relatively old stock of bacteria and diluting them in to fresh media these cells need to adapt to the nutrient rich environment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first phase of growth is the lag phase
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lag phase is a period of slow growth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the slow growth is most often attributed the need for cells to adapt to fast growth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lag phase has high biosynthesis rates enzymes needed to metabolise a variety of substrates are produced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the second phase of growth is the logarithmic phase log phase also known as the exponential phase
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the log phase is marked by rapid exponential growth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the rate at which cells grow during this phase is known as the growth rate k
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the time it takes the cells to double during the log phase is known as the generation time g
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the log phase nutrients are metabolised at maximum speed until they are all gone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the final phase of growth is the stationary phase
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this phase of growth is caused by depleted nutrients
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cells begin to shut down their metabolic activity as well as break down their own non essential proteins
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the stationary phase is a transition from rapid growth to dormancy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cells turn off all none essential functions such as bacterial conjugation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria as asexual organisms inherit an identical copy of their parent's genes i.e are clonal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all bacteria however have the ability to evolve and change their genetic material either through mutation or genetic recombination
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mutation occurs as a result of errors made during the replication of a gene and is most often gradual
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it occurs naturally and as a result of the presence of mutagens
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacteria can increase the rate of mutation during dna replication as a response to stress
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asexual reproduction does not afford an organism many opportunities to evolve its genome
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: certain types of bacteria are also capable of exchanging genetic information through bacterial conjugation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in conjugation one bacterium transfers genetic material to another through a mating bridge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the genetic material transferred may be either chromosomal or from a plasmid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: conjugation increases the genetic variability of bacterial populations and facilitates the emergences of antibiotic resistance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is often thought of as a primitive form of sexual reproduction however since gametes n are not uniting to form a zygote 2n this cannot be considered sexual reproduction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ability to transfer dna is not ubiquitous in the bacterial kingdom so all bacteria also rely on none transfer methods to diversify their dna
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most abundant genetic changes in bacterial genomes come from random mutation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of the most common ways that bacteria undergo genetic recombination is transduction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the process of transduction a virus alters the dna of a bacterium by injecting its own into the cell
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the bacteria's chromosome can then be altered by the viral dna if it is able to survive the reproduction of the virus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the genetic material of the virus was corrupted not allowing the cell to create the virus parts the bacteria would then most likely survive to reproduce and pass the altered chromosome to a daughter cell
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many bacteria can also take up exogenous environmental dna this method may be a prime method for antibiotic resistance to be passed between different species even different genera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because of their ability to quickly grow and the relative ease with which they can be manipulated bacteria have historically been the workhorses for the fields of molecular biology genetics and biochemistry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by making mutations in bacteria and examining the resulting phenotypes scientists have been able to determine the function of many different genes and enzymes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lessons learned from bacteria can then be applied to more complex organisms which are often more difficult to study
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: motile bacteria can move about using flagella bacterial gliding or changes of buoyancy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a unique group of bacteria the spirochaetes have structures similar to flagella called axial filaments between two membranes in the periplasmic space
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they have a distinctive helical body that twists about as it moves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacterial flagella are arranged in many different ways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria can have a single polar flagellum at one end of a cell clusters of many flagella at one end or flagella scattered all over the cell as with peritrichous
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many bacteria such as e.coli have two distinct modes of movement forward movement swimming and tumbling
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the tumbling allows them to reorient and introduces an important element of randomness in their forward movement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see external links below for link to videos motile bacteria are attracted or repelled by certain stimuli behaviors called taxes for instance chemotaxis phototaxis mechanotaxis and magnetotaxis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in one peculiar group the myxobacteria individual bacteria attract to form swarms and may differentiate to form fruiting bodies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the myxobacteria move only when on solid surfaces unlike e
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: coli which is motile in liquid or solid media
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: historically bacteria as originally studied by botanists were classified in the same way as plants that is mainly by shape
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria come in a variety of different cell morphologies shapes including bacillus rod-shape coccus spherical spirillum helical and vibrio curved bacillus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however because of their small size bacteria are relatively uniform in shape and therefore classification based on morphology was unsuccessful
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first formal classification scheme was developed following the development of the gram stain by hans christian gram which separates bacteria based on the structural characteristics of their cell walls
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this scheme included
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria are both harmful and useful to the environment and animals including humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the role of bacteria in disease and infection is important
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacteria act as pathogens and cause tetanus typhoid fever pneumonia syphilis cholera food borne illness leprosy and tuberculosis(tb
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sepsis a systemic infectious syndrome characterized by shock and massive vasodilation or localized infection can be caused by bacteria such as streptococcus staphylococcus or many gram negative bacteria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some bacterial infections can spread throughout the host's body and become systemic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in plants bacteria cause leaf spot fireblight and wilts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mode of infection includes contact air food water and insect borne microorganisms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the hosts infected with the pathogens may be treated with antibiotics which can be classified as bacteriocidal and bacteriostatic which at concentrations that can be reached in bodily fluids either kill bacteria or hamper their growth respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: antiseptic measures may be taken to prevent infection by bacteria for example by swabbing skin with alcohol prior to piercing the skin with the needle of a syringe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sterilization of surgical and dental instruments is done to make them sterile or pathogen free to prevent contamination and infection by bacteria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sanitizers and disinfectants are used to kill bacteria or other pathogens to prevent contamination and risk of infection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in soil microorganisms which reside in the rhizosphere a zone that includes the root surface and the soil that adheres to the root after gentle shaking help in the transformation of molecular dinitrogen gas as their source of nitrogen converting it to nitrogenous compounds in a process known as nitrogen fixation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this serves to provide an easily absorbable form of nitrogen for many plants which cannot fix nitrogen themselves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many other bacteria are found as symbionts in humans and other organisms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the presence of the gut flora in the large intestine can help prevent the growth of potentially harmful microbes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ability of bacteria to degrade a variety of organic compounds is remarkable
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: highly specialized groups of microorganisms play important roles in the mineralization of specific classes of organic compounds
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the decomposition of cellulose which is one of the most abundant constituents of plant tissues is mainly brought about by aerobic bacteria that belong to the genus cytophaga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this ability has also been utilized by humans in industry waste processing and bioremediation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria capable of digesting the hydrocarbons in petroleum are often used to clean up oil spills
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some beaches in prince william sound were fertilized in an attempt to facilitate the growth of such bacteria after the infamous 1989 exxon valdez oil spill
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these efforts were effective on beaches that were not too thickly covered in oil
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bacteria often in combination with yeasts and molds are used in the preparation of fermented foods such as cheese pickles soy sauce sauerkraut vinegar wine and yogurt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: using biotechnology techniques bacteria can be bioengineered for the production of therapeutic drugs such as insulin or for the bioremediation of toxic wastes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: friendly bacteria a common reference to those bacteria that offer some benefit to human hosts such as lactobacillus species which convert milk protein to lactic acid in the gut
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the presence of such bacterial colonies also inhibits the growth of potentially pathogenic bacteria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other bacteria that are helpful inside the body are many strains of e coli which is harmless and provides humans with vitamin k
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a website will often be the work of a single individual a business or organization or dedicated to a particular topic or purpose

lines.value: this is quite a blurry definition given the hypertext nature of the web the whole of wikipedia forms a website but whether the meta wikipedia pages are part of the same website or a sister website is open to debate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: web sites are written in or dynamically converted to html hyper text markup language and are accessed using software called a web browser
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: websites consist of static html pages or pages that are created dynamically using technologies such as active server pages asp or java server pages jsp
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a website also requires software known as an http server such as apache the most commonly used web server software used on the internet or microsoft's internet information server iis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often websites will also consist of content stored in one or more databases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plugins are also available for browsers which allow them to show active content such as flash shockwave or applets written in java
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dynamic html also provides for user interactivity and realtime element updating within webpages i.e pages don't have to be loaded or reloaded to effect any changes mainly using the dom and javascript support for which is built in for most modern browsers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are numerous types of websites each specializing in a particular service or use
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a few types of websites include many business websites have the appearance of s that is an advertisement that can be strolled around
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some websites act as vehicles to communicate with other people via webchat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: websites are constrained by architectural limits e.g the computing power dedicated to the website
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: very large websites such as yahoo microsoft google and most other very large sites employ several servers and load balancing equipment such as cisco content services switches or f5 bigip solutions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mousetrapping is a technique employed by some aggressive commercial websites especially pornographic ones that prevents one from leaving it depending on web browser settings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the webby awards are a set of awards presented to the world's best websites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as noted above there are several different spellings for this term
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although website is becoming the most commonly used particularly by newspapers and other media academia and some dictionaries such as oxford still prefer to use the two word capitalized spelling web site

lines.value: an alternate of the two word spelling is not capitalized

lines.value: as with many other newly created words it may take some time before a common spelling is finalized

lines.value: this controversy also applies to derivatives of web site website such as web master webmaster etc the associated press stylebook the preeminent authority in newspaper style suggests that it is web site web page and rather webcast webmaster

lines.value: dina teori probabilitas sebaran binomial negatip nyaeta anggota tina kulawarga sebaran probabilitas diskrit
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: three conventions are found in the literature two of them conflicting with each other
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the third generalizes the second rather than directly conflicting with it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: suppose we repeatedly throw a die and consider a 1 to be a success
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the probability of success on each trial is 1/6
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the number of trials needed to get three successes belongs to the infinite set { 3 4 5 6 } that number of trials is a negative binomially distributed random variable according to the first convention
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the number of failures before the third success belongs to the infinite set { 0 1 2 3 } that number of failures is a negative binomially distributed random variable according to the second convention
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the family of negative binomial distributions is parametrized by two parameters the fixed number r of successes and the probability p of success on each trial
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first parameter r is a positive integer the second parameter p is a real number between 0 and 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if r = 1 then we have a geometric distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the third convention referred to above r will not necessarily be an integer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this section we adhere to the first convention above the negative binomial distribution is the number of independent trials needed to get r successes with probability p of success on each trial
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if x r is a random variable following the negative binomial distribution with parameters r and p then x r is a sum of r independent variables following the geometric distribution with parameter p as a result of the central limit theorem x r is therefore approximately normal for sufficiently large r saterusna lamun y s ngarupakeun variabel random nu nuturkeun sebaran binomial mibanda paramater s jeung p mangka : = pr(after s trials there are at least r successes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this sense the negative binomial distribution is the inverse of the binomial distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sum of independent negative binomially distributed random variables with the same value of the parameter p but the r values r 1 and r 2 is negative binomially distributed with the same p but with r value r 1 + r 2 .the negative binomial distribution also arises as a continuous mixture of poisson distributions for which the poisson parameter &lambda was generated by a sebaran gamma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if we follow the convention that the negative binomial distribution is the probability distribution of the number of failures before the rth success then any negative binomial distribution is infinitely divisible i.e if x has a negative binomial distribution then for any positive integer n there exist independent identically distributed random variables x 1 , x n whose sum has the same distribution that x has
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these will not be negative binomially distributed in the sense defined above unless n is a divisor of r but see the third convention below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: suppose x is a random variable with a negative binomial distribution with parameters r and p the statement that the sum from x = r to infinity of the probability pr[x = x] is equal to 1 can be shown by a bit of algebra to be equivalent to the statement that 1 &minus p &minus r is what newton's binomial theorem says it should be.anggap y ngarupakeun variabel sebaran binomial mibanda parameter n sarta p pernyataan yen jumlah tina y = 0 ka n probabiliti pr[y = y] sarua jeung 1 sebutkeun yen 1 = p + 1 &minus p n nyaeta nuturkeun teorema binomial saperti nu diajarkeun dina aljabar di sma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus the negative binomial distribution bears the same relationship to the negative integer exponent case of the binomial theorem that the binomial distribution bears to the positive integer exponent case
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: assume p + q = 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then the binomial theorem of elementary algebra implies that in that case it is defined even when n is negative or is not an integer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: but in our case of the binomial distribution it is zero when x > n so why would we write the result in that form with a seemingly needless sum of infinitely many zeros
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the answer comes when we generalize the binomial theorem of elementary algebra to newton's binomial theorem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then we can say for example is just the probability that the number of failures before the rth success is equal to x provided r is an integer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if r is a negative non integer so that the exponent is a positive non integer then some of the terms in the sum above are negative so we do not have a probability distribution on the set of all nonnegative integers this brings us to the third convention mentioned above allow non integer values of r then we have a generalized negative binomial distribution that coincides with the second convention above when r happens to be a positive integer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: recall from above that :the sum of independent negative binomially distributed random variables with the same value of the parameter p but the r values r 1 and r 2 is negative binomially distributed with the same p but with r value r 1 + r 2 .this property persists when the definition is thus generalized and affords a quick way to see that the negative binomial distribution is infinitely divisible
lines.name: Sundanese
